paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, specifically V30M and Y78F, in the context of TTR amyloidogenesis and the development of inhibitors.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with neuropathy and cardiac symptoms at age 40.
The patient was diagnosed with severe neuropathy at age 48.

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is known to destabilize the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.population_frequency: Allele frequency in gnomAD is approximately 0.02%.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is one of the most common mutations associated with FAP.
key_quotes: Among known TTR mutants, the V30M is the most common FAP mutation.
The presence of mutations in TTR results in destabilization of the tetramer.

individual_records.phenotype_details: cognitive decline and amyloid deposition in the brain
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient exhibited cognitive decline and amyloid deposition in the brain at age 55.

functional_data.summary: The Y78F variant is associated with increased amyloidogenicity.

variants.population_frequency: Allele frequency in gnomAD is approximately 0.01%.
variants.additional_notes: The Y78F variant is noted for its high amyloidogenic potential.
key_quotes: The Y78F variant is the most amyloidogenic.
Amyloid structures derived from wild-type (WT)-TTR can deposit in the heart and peripheral nerves.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants were extracted successfully.
